titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Records WAG.130
titlestmt.author: Nicole Greenhouse

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 16:00:47 -0500.

change.item: edited by Nicole Greenhouse to reflect additional administrative information and added archived websites.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Records
did.abstract: Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 represents telecommunication workers in Westerchester and Putnam counties. The collection contains materials from the 1989 campaign and the archived website.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Robert McCracken, President of the Communications Workers of America, Local 1103, in 1994. The accession number associated with this gift is 1987.013.

http://www.cwa1103.org/ was initially selected by curators and captured through the use of The California Digital Library's Web Archiving Service in 2009 as part of Labor Unions and Organizations (U.S.) Web Archive. In 2015, the website was migrated to Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In 2019, http://www.cwa1103.org/index.cfm?zone=/unionactive/past_articles.cfm&localnum=1103 was added to better capture the website. The accession number associated with this website is 2019.140.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 received its charter on May 12, 1961 with 900 members. By the 1990s, the union had grown to representing over 2000 New York telephone workers in Westchester and Putnam counties. Daniel Keenan was president from 1964-1979 and Robert McCracken was president from 1989-2007. As of this writing (2014) Kevin Sheil is president of the union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains materials related to the 1989 union elections and lawsuits related to the union. It also includes the archived website for the union, which has been captured by NYU since 2009.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection has not been arranged by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by the Communications Workers of America, Local 1103, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In 2014, an inventory was added and the archived websites were added as a series.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Records; WAG 130; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

To cite the archived website in this collection: Identification of item, date; Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Records; WAG 130; Wayback URL; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

appraisal.head: Take Down Policy
appraisal.p: Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

controlaccess.subject: Telecommunication |x Employees |x Labor unions |z New York (State)

dao.xlink:title: Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Archived Website

daodesc.p: Communications Workers of America, Local 1103 Archived Website: March 2009-ongoing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The website contains the CWA Local 1103 newsletter, the Eagle; event listings; union news; strikes; contracts; agreements; and other information on benefits. Also includes the member page for with information about union events and happenings, registration information, educational resources about worker rights, committees, and community activities.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: New site crawls are accrued semiannually.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of cwa1103.org and www.cwa1103.org/index.cfm?zone=/unionactive/past_articles.cfm&localnum=1103 in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints.
